intro: Aristeguietia cacalioides, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and oval-shaped, while its stems are erect and branched. Aristeguietia cacalioides plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
